bony adjective
(CONTAINING BONE)
medical
  specialized made of bone or a substance like bone: Surgery can correct bony deformities of the feet. In a horse's jaw, a bony plate separates food and air passages. The animal has boney, armour-like plates on its back.
containing a lot of bones: bony fish
More examplesFewer examplesTeeth decay occurs when bacteria in the mouth produce acids, which dissolve the hard, bony tissue of the tooth.The pituitary gland in the brain is well protected in a bony capsule at the base of the skull.Complications can include boney growths around the joint.
